1.title: Shopping at the Farmers' Market
1.plot: Farmers' markets feature the fresh, healthy, flavorful foods you CRAVE. They provide an opportunity to shop locally and meet the farmers and vendors who provide the good, clean, whole food that is so important to our health, plus it fuels the local economy. Did you know? $62 of every $100 spent at a farmers' market, goes back into the local economy.

2.title: How to Tune Up a Bike
2.plot: Bike riding is an easy way to get MOVING. Whether you are a seasoned biker or just an occasional rider, it is important to keep your bike tuned up. Before your hit the trails this summer be sure to take a look at your bike or bring it into a local bike shop to get it ready for riding.

3.title: Sun Safety Tips
3.plot: Summer is heating up and we've got you covered, literally! Exposure to the sun can cause damage to your skin, eyes and immune system. Protect yourself with these sun safety tips and what to look for when buying sunscreen.

4.title: Safe Summer Fun
4.plot: Catch the latest Summer fun and safety tips from Riverside Ambulance and EMS experts. Protect you and your family with great advice for healthy outdoor grilling, avoiding heat stroke and safe travels.

5.title: Kid-Approved Snacks
5.plot: This week's episode of CRAVE features help from the Riverside Health Fitness Center's Summer Campers as they create fun, healthy, kid-approved snacks that are sure to make playing with your food fun and tasty!

6.title: Running Tips
6.plot: Running can be fun and a great way to shed some pounds this summer.

7.title: Let's Plan a Staycation!
7.plot: Vacations are a great way to recharge. By leaving these days unused, you are putting yourself at risk for increased stress which can lead to other health risks. If you need a break but don't want the hassle (or cost!) of planning a vacation, a staycation might be in order! Here are some family-friendly ways to have fun near home.

8.title: Knee Health: You KNEE-D to Know This!
8.plot: Knee problems account for more than 19 million physician visits each year. In fact, it is the most common reason for seeing an orthopedic surgeon. Significant advances in surgical treatment, including minimally invasive advanced procedures can reduce pain and disability associated with osteoarthritis

9.title: Summer BBQ's
9.plot: This week's episode of CRAVE features tips from area BBQ pros about preparation, flavor infusion and the secrets to keeping barbecue lovers coming back for more! When you fire up the grill, follow these tips to enjoy the sweetness of summer with the savory flavors of a summertime barbecue.

10.title: MOVE: 15 Minute Workout (No Equipment Required!)
10.plot: Getting a great workout in doesn't have to take 2-3 hours. If you have 15 minutes you can get your sweat on whether you are at home or the gym. Here is a high intensity circuit to help get you back to your fitness goals.

11.title: How to Tackle & Organize Your Life Today!
11.plot: Is clutter taking over your life? Tackle clutter head on with these organizational tips!

12.title: Back to School Anxiety
12.plot: A new school year is just about to start, and most kids are feeling mixed emotions-excitement and a bit of anxiousness, too.

13.title: Garden-to-Table
13.plot: This week's episode of CRAVE features chef Steven Long of Riverside Healthcare Assisted Living in Bourbonnais as we learn to enjoy the fruits - and veggies - of our labor by making a fresh, garden-to-table recipe.

14.title: Healthy Habits Start with You
14.plot: An alarming percentage of our future generations is suffering from childhood obesity. There are many programs out there that aide in the fight but as parents we are their number one influence and healthy habits start with you.

15.title: How to Lower Your Blood Pressure Naturally!
15.plot: Have you ever heard of the "silent killer?" Untreated high blood pressure, or hypertension, directly increases the risk for heart attack and stroke. Learn ways how to lower blood pressure naturally!

16.title: The Prostate & Men's Health Awareness
16.plot: Although men of all ages should have routine checkups with their health care provider, many men wait to seek routine care until they are in their 40's. While there may be many reasons for this, men are generally reluctant to see a health care provider routinely. However, many of the top 10 causes of death and disability can be prevented or delayed with early diagnosis and treatment.

17.title: Healthy & Wholesome: Cheesy Cauliflower
17.plot: Food that is good for you should taste good, too! In this episode of CRAVE, our friends at Stella Bear Foods teach us how to make a fresh recipe that tastes great using wholesome ingredients found in your own kitchen!

18.title: How to Plank
18.plot: Need to get a workout in but don't have much time or space? Challenge your mind and your body with a little move called the plank.

19.title: Alzheimer's Caregiver Tips
19.plot: Are you caring for a loved one with Alzheimer's or dementia? You're not alone. In the United States, there are about 15 million caring for a loved one. Here are some tips and advice for caregivers, their loved ones and when it is time to seek additional help.

20.title: About 3D Mammography
20.plot: Riverside Healthcare is pleased to offer the latest advancement in breast cancer screening with 3D Mammography exams. Utilizing advanced breast tomosynthesis technology developed by Hologic, Inc., a leader in women's health, Riverside's latest technology is clinically proven to significantly increase the detection of small tumors sooner than conventional mammography while simultaneously decreasing the need for follow-up mammograms and additional diagnostic testing.

21.title: Recipes for Diabetics
21.plot: In this episode of #HealthCurrents CRAVE, we're visiting the experts from the Riverside Diabetes Wellness Center to raise awareness and learn about taking control of diabetes without sacrificing the flavors you CRAVE during Diabetes Awareness Month.

22.title: Chair Workout for Limited Mobility
22.plot: Limited in mobility or need a workout with adapted forms? Take a deep breath and join us for a Therapeutic Tai Chi-in-a-chair demonstration that is made for all ages and fitness levels.

23.title: DIY Gifts
23.plot: The average adult spends over $800 during the holidays. Not only is that a toll on your wallet, but it makes for a pretty stressful holiday season. Stay on track with these easy DIY gift ideas!

24.title: Rush-Riverside Cancer Institute Expansion
24.plot: Riverside Healthcare announced the completion and grand opening of the expanded Rush-Riverside Cancer Institute in Bourbonnais. The Rush-Riverside Cancer Institute, home to the Betty Burch Bridgewater Center for Radiation Therapy, is now also home to the Center for Medical Oncology uniting Riverside's cancer care experts as well as providing expanded services, treatments, technologies and support under one roof. Everything about the Institute is focused on providing an ideal experience and the very best care and comfort for patients and their families.

25.title: DIY Hot Chocolate Bar & More
25.plot: The holidays are among us and 'tis the season to celebrate! In this episode of CRAVE, we'll share a few of our favorite holiday hostess ideas with a festive, easy hot chocolate bar that is fun for all ages to help make your celebrations entertaining, tasty and very merry!

26.title: Fitness Tracker Buying Guide
26.plot: Activity tracker, sleep tracking, waterproof, GPS, heart rate monitor, these are some of the many features available to anyone seeking a fitness tracker. Not wanting to make an investment until you have seen it in action? I've tested out a few of the top rated fitness trackers and just so I could help you find the activity band that is right for you.

27.title: 10 Easy Ways to Be a Happier Healthier You
27.plot: Looking for easy ways to be a happier, healthier you? Try these tips, which focus on making simple changes that will impact both the mind, body and spirit.

28.title: Riverside Healthcare: 2015 Year in Review
28.plot: Riverside is putting Well Within Reach in more ways than ever before for you and your family. With our focus on providing quality, caring and convenience for your busy lives, Riverside can help you be well and stay healthy all year round. Learn more about all the ways we care for you in this edition of HealthCurrents.

29.title: Top New Year's Wellness Tips
29.plot: It's a new year with new goals! And often times the most popular resolution is to lose weight by eating better and healthier. In this episode of #HealthCurrents CRAVE, we'll learn the top ways to keep your nutrition and wellness goals on track with tips from Wellness Coach Casey Babinski.

30.title: Taste of Zumba
30.plot: Looking to get fit this New Year? Or want to try something new? Get a "taste" of Zumba on this week's edition of #HealthCurrents MOVE.

31.title: How to Get Healthier Winter Skin
31.plot: Do you get dry, cracked skin? Get glowing skin with these must-have skincare tips! Plus, learn what foods help keep you hydrated and fight signs of aging on today's #HealthCurrents LIVE.

32.title: Riverside Immediate Care Puts Well Within Reach
32.plot: With more than 140 Riverside Medical Group providers including primary care physicians throughout five counties, six Riverside Immediate Care locations and the area's leading emergency department, Riverside Healthcare has the very best care available for you and your family 24 hours a day, 7 days a week, 365 days a year when and where you need it.

33.title: Wine 101
33.plot: Here's a toast to health-conscious wine lovers everywhere. We'll explore the fun, experimental and tasty environment at Grapes and Hops wine boutique to learn the basics of Wine 101.

34.title: Resistance Band: No Gym Required
34.plot: Don't worry about getting to the gym to get in a good workout, in this week's episode of HealthCurrents MOVE we've put together a workout that doesn't require a gym membership. No matter your fitness level you can get in a good workout by using resistance bands, plus you can do it anywhere!

35.title: Hiding Nutrients in Your Foods
35.plot: Looking for ways to hide extra nutrients in your food? Riverside Medical Group's Dr. Doroba discusses the importance of vitamins and ways to incorporate nutrient-rich ingredients into your meals. Plus, this mother and daughter duo is making nutritious chicken noodle soup!

36.title: Focus on Senior Behavior Health
36.plot: The changes that often come in later life-retirement, the death of loved ones, increased isolation, medical problems-can sometimes create greater challenges including mental health issues. It is estimated that 20% of older adults may experience the need for behavioral health services. There is help. Riverside Behavioral Health offers a spectrum of services for all ages including seniors. To learn how to help yourself or loved one overcome these or other mental health challenges....

37.title: Healthy Foods Under $1
37.plot: Myth: Healthy eating breaks the budget. Truth: Healthy eating is nutritious, delicious and doesn't mean breaking the bank. Learn about healthy foods that cost less than $1 per serving in this episode of HealthCurrents CRAVE.

38.title: Exercise at Your Desk!
38.plot: Studies show that sitting 8 to 9 hours a day can raise your risk for heart disease, cancer and diabetes. Don't allow yourself to become a statistic, in this week's episode of HealthCurrents MOVE we've put together a mini workout that can be done right from your desk. Check out healthcurrents.com for more ways you can stay active while working a desk job.

39.title: More Than Just Art: Health and Wellness Benefits of Creativity
39.plot: Lately, it seems art has been quite the trend and for good reason. Studies have found that creative self-expression and exposure to the arts benefits both cognitive and psychosocial health. It's also been shown to have a host of benefits for physical conditions, such as cancer, dementia and Parkinson's disease.

40.title: Designing New Patient Experiences Introducing Riverside Healthcare Frankfort Campus
40.plot: The Frankfort Campus complements and enhances Riverside Healthcare's mission to deliver remarkable health care experiences for each and every person. From the moment you enter our doors, we believe you will agree. The 21,000-square-foot environment is carefully designed with you and your family's health and well-being in mind. Design and decor not only incorporates the surrounding comforts of nature but also seamlessly blends sophisticated technology and varied needs into a supportive and collaborative setting for providers, clinicians, techs and care teams.

41.title: Healthy Smoothies
41.plot: Tune in to this episode of #HealthCurrents CRAVE for healthy smoothie tips from Riverside Health Fitness Center. We'll help you go beyond taste and teach you how to add ingredients to fit your lifestyle and boost your health!

42.title: Under 10 Minute Ab Workout
42.plot: While you can't exercise only your abs, this quick ab workout in this episode of HealthCurrents MOVE can be added to the end of your normal exercise regiment 2-3 times a week. Repeat workout 2-3 times. Don't forget to check out healthcurrents.com for more ab exercises.

43.title: How to Identify the Early Signs of Autism
43.plot: The most recent CDC report estimates that the autism rate in children is 1 in 50. On this segment of HealthCurrents LIVE, we're discussing the early signs and symptoms of Autism and other common behavioral health issues. Plus, we share tips to help your child thrive.

44.title: Riverside Healthcare Frankfort Campus Now Open
44.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

45.title: Fiesta Salsa
45.plot: Add a little vida to your menu with sometimes spicy, sometimes sweet and always tasty, salsa! And for a fresher alternative, try making your own salsa-you may be surprised just how easy it is. Tune in to this episode of HealthCurrents CRAVE for a quick, authentic salsa recipe that is good for your health and your taste buds.

46.title: 10 Minute Mommy & Me Workout
46.plot: As a busy mom of a toddler it can be difficult finding time to work out but no one says it can't be done. Here is a fun, quick workout you can do with your kids. Check out healthcurrents.com for more fun ways you can get a work out in with your kids.

47.title: Yoga to Help De-stress
47.plot: Yoga offers a host of benefits both physically and mentally. Yoga helps boost the immune system, improve respiration and vitality, and reduces the risk for heart disease. Additionally, yoga has a lot of benefits to help put the mind at ease. Yoga can relieve stress, improve self-esteem and increase energy levels. Learn more on today's segment of HealthCurrents LIVE!

48.title: Introducing Neurohospitalists
48.plot: If you or a loved one is hospitalized due to stroke, traumatic injury or neurological impairment or patients, the addition of a Neurohospitalist to your care team can maximize the quality and outcomes of the care you receive. Learn more on this week's edition of WAVE...

49.title: Shopping at the Farmers' Market
49.plot: Farmers' markets feature the fresh, healthy, flavorful foods you CRAVE. They provide an opportunity to shop locally and meet the farmers and vendors who provide the good, clean, whole food that is so important to our health, plus it fuels the local economy. Did you know? $62 of every $100 spent at a farmers' market, goes back into the local economy. Join the conversation on social media! #healthcurrents

50.title: Exercises for Good Posture
50.plot: Proper posture has an effect on not only your health but can also improve your image and boost confidence. Check out this week's episode of #HealthCurrents MOVE to learn some exercises and stretches that help promote good posture.

51.title: Fruit Infused Water to Help You Stay Hydrated
51.plot: A recent survey reveals that 75% of Americans are chronically dehydrated. With summer right around the corner, it's important to keep you (and your little ones!) hydrated. Here are some fun, fruit infused options to give your water a refreshing boost!

52.title: Protect the Skin You Are In
52.plot: In the good ol' summertime you need to take care of the skin you are in. In this segment of HealthCurrents, Riverside Medical Group Oncologist Dr. Annebelle Veerapaneni talks about protecting yourself from the harmful rays of the sun.

53.title: Riverside's Pediatric Hospitalist Program
53.plot: Riverside Healthcare's partnership with the University of Chicago Medicine Comer Children's Hospital brings award-winning inpatient care to the region's youngest patients around-the-clock beginning in August.

54.title: Cancer Care & Awareness Resources
54.plot: The Rush-Riverside Cancer Institute has taken cancer care to the next level. With greater access to the latest technology from screenings to diagnosis and follow-up care, you'll have more powerful ways to fight cancer while remaining close to your home and family at whichever location you choose - Bourbonnais, Frankfort or Watseka. At Rush-Riverside Cancer Institute, we do much more than treat your cancer, we work to health the whole person, mind, body and spirit.

imdb.plot outline: Looking to gain control of your own health? Searching for your own path to wellness? Riverside HealthCurrents can make your journey more enjoyable, informative and entertaining. Whether you CRAVE a healthy snack or want to MOVE to stay fit and have fun, we are here to help. Learn to LIVE in ways that set your mind, body and spirit free, and catch the latest WAVE of information to keep you and those you love looking and feeling great.
imdb.title: HealthCurrents
plot: Looking to gain control of your own health? Searching for your own path to wellness? Riverside _HealthCurrents_ (qv) can make your journey more enjoyable, informative and entertaining. Whether you CRAVE a healthy snack or want to MOVE to stay fit and have fun, we are here to help. Learn to LIVE in ways that set your mind, body and spirit free, and catch the latest WAVE of information to keep you and those you love looking and feeling great.
